website_summaries.verdict: Soft, skin-like nipples combined with a vented base make this a top choice for breastfed babies who take a portion of their daily feeds from a bottle.
pros: Soft silicone nipples have a natural feel that most breastfed babies readily accept
Vented base minimizes air intake, reducing gas and digestive discomfort
Cap pulls double duty as a measuring cup
Fewer pieces and a wide opening make cleaning a breeze
cons: Extra care is needed during assembly to prevent leaks

customer_reviews.title: Perfec Bottle for Picky Opinionated Babies
customer_reviews.text: If you are reading this at 2AM wishing you had a bottle that your partner could feed the baby while you crawl underneath a blanket and hide for awhile, then this is the bottle for you. The packaging boasts a 90%ish acceptance by little sleep thieves and sure enough my pick little fifteen pounder took to this bottle after kicking a line up of bottles to the curb. It’s seriously a good bottle and worth buying now so that you get it maximum two days from now.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndit

customer_reviews.title: Theses Just Flatout Work... Period!
customer_reviews.text: Our son is now going on 4 months and the fact we can count the number of spit ups or severe gas episodes on one hand. The results from the bottles says a lot. Easy to clean because the entire bottle breaks down easily. You have to love a product that just works. Others saying the bottle leaks did not push down the pieces tightly. It’s plastic it will not break. If you have bottle sanitizer you will appreciate being able to break the bottles down to get more in. I can’t say enough about MAMS products and these bottles are our favorites!
customer_reviews.author: R. P.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: 5week old took this bottle above all others.
customer_reviews.text: I’m currently breast feeding but I need my baby to take a bottle too. I got a recommendation from a breastfeeding mom that the MAM bottle is easy to go back and forth from breast feeding to bottle feeding. I have found this to be true. I’ve tried about 6 different brands and this one is the winner.
customer_reviews.author: ruth

customer_reviews.title: Melting?!?!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these before off Amazon and I didn't have a problem, I've also bought these at Walmart and didn't have a problem. However when I ordered them again from Amazon they melted, so of course Amazon just replace them. The real problem came when The Replacements also melted. The instructions say to boil just like any other bottle and I assure you we have plenty of bottles! So I'm not sure why all of a sudden they aren't holding up to the first boil. The only difference between past purchases was that we had the neutral with the frogs, and these are more boyish with foxes. Overall... cute designs, tons of parts and the possibility of melting.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Not slow flow!
customer_reviews.text: Mom's beware! Level 1 nipples are still way too fast for a newborn. My almost five week old was choking trying to keep up with the flow. There's nothing moderated about the nipple output unlike Dr. Brown's bottles. I was looking for an alternative to the Dr. Brown's as they are continuously leaking and making me crazy. Sadly, the MAM failed to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: beth

customer_reviews.title: Wrong bottle
customer_reviews.text: These are great my daughter loves them my only complaint is that I paid extra to have a specific design which was the jungle print and they sent me rabbits instead which was not what I had bought on the page just clarify before purchase
customer_reviews.author: michael d.

customer_reviews.title: Great bottle
customer_reviews.text: These are great! My son loves these bottles. I like the self-sanitizing you can do with them. The nipple is nice and big so my little guy gets a good hold of it without too much milk getting all over the place. It seems like it is just more comfortable to him than other nipples. My only complaint is that it is hard to gauge how much milk is left once it gets down into the non-transparent bottom. It's not a big deal (hence my 5 stars), but I do like to know roughly how much milk is left when he finishes and if it's below the lowest mark I have no idea.
customer_reviews.author: VHenry

customer_reviews.title: Best transitioning bottles
customer_reviews.text: My baby took so well to the nipples when transitioning her from breast to bottle. No nipple confusion. She eats well on these bottles especially after trying other bottles like avent and kiinde. The only problems are all the pieces. You have to make sure to screw on everything correctly otherwise it will leak. We just put water in the bottle to test it making sure there are no leaks prior to putting in my breast milk. Definitely recommend these bottles for breastfeeding mothers.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Baird

customer_reviews.title: Very fast flow on NB level
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good bottles and we do use them. My main complaint is the lowest nipple flow is still pretty fast; I would say it's at least one step faster than Playtex bottles. As a result we can't feed our 2 month old from them when she is too sleepy because she chokes and gets upset. The speed means she also gets more burps from them. I do recommend them, just not for newborns at all.
customer_reviews.author: E. Sankin

customer_reviews.title: If I could give this 1000 starts I would
customer_reviews.text: This bottle saved my sanity. I have been exclusively breastfeeding for 5 months since baby would not take a bottle. I have tried about 10 bottles before this one. THIS IS THE ONLY ONE SHE DRANK FROM!!! I am one happy mama. The flow was still a little too fast (size 2) so I had to buy size 1 nipples for now. I also like how the whole bottle comes apart for cleaning purposes. Also a bonus how you can sterilize it in the microwave. (look it up online- it shows you how to assemble the bottle specifically to do this)
customer_reviews.author: Silly4Lilly

customer_reviews.title: High Maintenace Bottles
customer_reviews.text: When did bottles become so difficult? From lid to bottom these have 6 different parts. If you don't put them together just right....they leak. It also means 6 different parts to wash. I am a Grandma, and a caregiver to 2 grandsons. I guess I am just old school. My oldest grandson used Latch bottles. I actually like them better. These mam bottles also make a loud noise sometimes. It sounds like sneakers skidding on a floor. Im not sure what causes that. I understand that the new bottles are supposed to help with colic. I guess that I just miss the old simple bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Clements

customer_reviews.title: Just Buy Them.
customer_reviews.text: These are hands down the best bottles we have purchased. They have directions on how to serialize the bottles in the microwave (extremely easy to do). My daughter is 6 months old and she needed a new bottles with a 6 months bottle nipple. The only complaint I have is the bottles only have the lower month nipples on them. I ordered the 6 month old nipples separate and got rid of the nipples it came with. ALWAYS switch out the nipples as your baby grows you don’t want them to struggle to get a couple drops out. You won’t regret buying them guaranteed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are probably the best bottles on the market
customer_reviews.text: These are probably the best bottles on the market. My sons gas and sore tummy immediately stopped once we started using these bottles. There is something about the nipple design that keeps him eating longer without wanting to pull away and he even finishes his bottles faster. I will not buy another brand of bottle. This is the one!
customer_reviews.author: Haley B.

customer_reviews.title: Leaks!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly i thought id love these because theyre so recommended!! But i hate this bottle! Theres too many pieces, it usually leaks, its a pain to take all the peices apart and honestly i think it makes it harder to clean!
customer_reviews.author: Galyean

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!! I was using Dr browns for my daughter and I am glad I switched to this one. Easy to clean and does not leak like Dr browns and if you are wondering if you can warm it wity dr browns bottle warmer yes you can. Great bottle wish I had bought this one a long time ago
customer_reviews.author: Wgslabs

customer_reviews.title: ugly but works for breastfed babies
customer_reviews.text: WE TRIED MANY BOTTLES and she would not take any of them. After 3 months of trying, someone suggested this one to me. It is the ugliest bottle I've ever seen but she takes it like a champ. Thank you MAM for making this nipple like your pacifier! I am able to go to work and not stress now. My breast fed baby finally takes milk from someone besides me!!
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the only bottles my daughter would ...
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the only bottles my daughter would take when she first started daycare, but there are 5 pieces (nipple, nipple ring, bottle body, bottle bottom, bottle anti-colic silicone insert) which make it a huge pain to clean. I got it because she prefers the MAM pacifiers and the nipples are shaped the same between the bottle and the pacifier. However, I found that the MAM bottle nipples fit the Avent wide mouth bottles. This reduces the number of pieces to clean from 5 to 3 (nipple, nipple ring, bottle body).
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Less gassy compared to other popular bottle brands, no leaking nipples, no nipple confusion
customer_reviews.text: We tried 5 other of the popular bottle brands before giving this a try. Mam bottles changed our lives! Thank you! These were the only bottles that didn’t give our baby too much gas. The vent on the bottom of the bottle is genius, you can hear the air escaping so you KNOW it’s working! In other bottle brands, we experienced nipples that would leak and we never have with these. The nipple our baby loves as well as it’s naturally shaped how a mother’s nipple is when baby feeds. We never had any nipple confusion. Would suggest these bottles to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend. Have tried various bottles
customer_reviews.text: HIghly, Highly recommend. Have tried various bottles, including Dr Brown, advent, etc. these are by far the best. LOVE the self sterilizing option. So convenient. Baby had NO issues adjusting to nipple. Have had no leaking issues either. The only time it "seems like it's leaking" is after cleaning you might have water leak out from bottom as you feed, but it is water, not milk, and stops quickly as it's just residual from sterilizing. I will buy these for all new mom's I know. The transition to MAM sippy cup is great too...the nipple on the sippy cup is just like the bottle and super easy for baby to switch.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Fox

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for exclusively breastfed babies
customer_reviews.text: My little girl loves her mam bottles! She was exclusively breastfed till 5 months and these were the only bottles that she took too. I started out using level 0 nipple and moved up to level 3. She is now 9 months old. I like the design of the bottle and how easy it is to clean, unlike dr brown bottle wear you jeed a little brush to clean out the blue vent, this bottle you just unscrew to bottom and pop out the little rubber insert. The bottle is also wide so you don't need a special bottle brush to clean the inside. So convenient and perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Page

customer_reviews.title: Baby and mom approved!
customer_reviews.text: Before my daughter was born I planned on using Doctor Brown bottles. However, once she got here and began feeding she just didn't seem to like feeding from these bottles. She would scream intermittently during feeding and would get choked. Not to mention constant hiccups. So I tried these MAM bottles I'd received in my Amazon and Walmart gift box's. She loved them! No more screaming, hiccups or troublesome feeds. Her and I both are so pleased with these bottles and I have since purchased more. Don't hesitate to purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Burleson

customer_reviews.title: Best bottles for my newborn
customer_reviews.text: Received this bottles as sample gift at pea in a pod and had to buy more. Best bottles ever for my newborn, she can go back and forth from breast to bottle without a problem and they are easy to clean and sterilize. She does not get gassy and prevents reflux as stated. Also love mam pacifiers as well.
customer_reviews.author: Yunissa Koury

customer_reviews.title: It’s a baby bottle.
customer_reviews.text: Good bottle. You just have to make sure the rubber piece that goes in the bottom is completely dry before you put it in the bottle or it will stick trapping the air inside instead of venting it like it’s supposed to. I’ve noticed people having problems with this but if it’s completely air dried before putting together. I never have problems. The only thing I don’t like is that it doesn’t vent fast enough. Air bubbles still get sucked through the nipple when my grandson lets go of the nipple. It vents just not enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great Bottles!  Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about these bottles. I have a 5 month old and have had no issues at all! I was all about glass bottles because of bps (google it). Glass bottles are super heavy for a baby...then I got silicone bottles and the didn't slide in and out of my diaper pag easily and they attracted dust and hair. My friend have me a small sample bottle and my son loved it! To my surprise, they seek to be the only company advertising that all of their products are bps (and of course bpa) free! Go Mam! I got the neutral colored ones so I can use them for any baby! Thanks for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite bottles!
customer_reviews.text: These are by far our favorite bottles. We’ve tried advent, Tommy tippy, Dr Browns and these are definitely preferred by my babe. He is exclusively breast fed but gets a bottle of expressed milk on occasion and these offer a seemless transition. I love that the nipple has little indentions for the babies lips so it’s easier to grip. I’ve also noticed that we lose less milk with these (when he’s drinking and milk leaks out of the side of his mouth). We are now exclusively using these bottles.
customer_reviews.author: kmjames22

customer_reviews.title: Save your Money
customer_reviews.text: I bought theses and about every other bottle out there and ended up going with the cheap Gerber First Essentials. They work just as good. These are very similar to Playtex bottles but the nipple is different. They are heavy and bulky and if you do not get the rubber ring in the bottom lined up perfect it will leak everywhere. My daughter has horrible reflux and gas so I tried EVERYTHING out there and would spend any amount to make her more comfortable.... Save your money buy the Gerber Bottles there is no difference in the Anti-Colic / Anti-Gas department. The Gerber ones are lighter so easier for baby to learn to hold and a ton easier clean!
customer_reviews.author: Lakota

customer_reviews.title: MAM bottles are the best. I love how easy they are to clean ...
customer_reviews.text: MAM bottles are the best. I love how easy they are to clean and sanitize. The wide mouth makes it easy to fill them, and my son has liked the nipples since the beginning. These come with a size 2 nipple which is a little too much for a newborn, I think he started using the size 2 around 2.5-3 months. Until then I just bought a couple extra size 1s to use on these. I really like the way the bottles look as well, it's a cool design. That's definitely the least important factor though, lol.
customer_reviews.author: JennnTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for breastfed babies but beware there are a lot of pieces
customer_reviews.text: This is the only bottle my breastfed baby seemed to like. The main downside is that there are so many pieces! We forgot to put the inner bottom liner in once and accidentally poured milk out at the doctors office when preparing a bottle since there are aeration holes in the outside base :( but overall it’s a good bottle, baby likes it, and despite the number of pieces, easy to clean. Recommend for parents trying to introduce a bottle to a breastfed baby.
customer_reviews.author: cke

customer_reviews.title: Love but can’t use
customer_reviews.text: I thought this bottle would be a win since the nipple is smaller than most wide nipples and my 2m old loves the Mam pacifiers but I don’t think I’ll be able to use these bottle right now maybe when he gets older. The shape of the nipple is perfect but I wish they had a smaller Nipple instead of the size advertised. My son has a tongue tie and his mouth and chin is on the smaller side so the wider nipple causes him to loose his latch often and swallow air. Other than that the bottle is great.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Love, love
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love these bottles. MAM has provided me with so much relief. My son refused Dr. Browns, Born Free, etc. bottles. I really didn't know what I was going to do when I went back to work. I found these and he loves them. No problems at all. Great for switching back and forth from bottle to breast. Would recommend these to anyone breastfeeding.
customer_reviews.author: CCollins

customer_reviews.title: Favorite favorite baby bottle
customer_reviews.text: Favorite favorite baby bottle!!!. We initially received 3 oz MAM bottle through the mail as a promotion but our baby fell in love with it that we had to search on amazon to get more. Our baby tried Dr. Brown's ones but did not like it after first try. The nipple on these MAM ones are very soft and comfortable. Our baby continues to breastfeed while using these MAM ones. The parts of these bottles are removable for easy washing. The bottles could be sanitized in the microwave. Plus, these are made in Europe, specifically Austria. Highly highly recommend these bottles.
customer_reviews.author: G. williams

customer_reviews.title: Mam bottles
customer_reviews.text: Mam is the ONLY BOTTLE our little one will/ can take. We tried dr.brown, playtex, tommee tippee and Como tomo. She was born 6 weeks early and has had bad tummy problems. I would recommend them to anyone. The shape if the nipples seem easy for her to latch and the bottle size is good. The negative is I wished you cold measure the milk better as they drink. You have to guess after 3oz .
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, great on-the-go, takes some practice, excellent bottle!
customer_reviews.text: When I was pregnant and researching products for our registry, I thought this would be fun to try. Once you get a routine down for assembling the parts for sterilizing, it is super quick and convenient. I love the shape of the nipple, and our baby also had no issues with nipple confusion. When some of our family member’s have fed tje baby, they haven’t liked that the bottom plastic piece is white, because they kept thinking there was more milk left. We had no issues with it, but you might want to train family/babysitters on how to use it. It’s my go to bottle. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Marco Mena

customer_reviews.title: Only bottles my baby will take
customer_reviews.text: I have an exclusively breast fed baby, but I had to return to work at 8 weeks. These are the only bottles my baby will take. She is 12 weeks now and just switched to nipples to medium flow #2. My husband has no issues feeding her when I'm not home with pumped milk and we haven't had any issues with gas or reflux. Every baby is different but these definitely gave me peace of mind to return to work! I received a free one at babies r us with our registry and they are the only ones we buy now, Amazon has much better prices!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Villa

customer_reviews.title: Our bottle of choice.
customer_reviews.text: The sample worked. We were given one of these in a sample box and in a moment of “we need a bottle” started using it. The rest is history, our daughter seems to prefer this nipple to others and having the options of buying various nipples for different flow rate is great. They do seem to help with gas and luckily with diligent burping we don’t have many problems with spit up. Quite please with these bottles and would say our daughter has hooked us for the next year or so.
customer_reviews.author: DrExploreMore

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased bc 2 week old was very colicky and was told these bottles would help. They made a world of difference. Was nervous that the nipple would be an issue bc she was taking a different type. But she adjusted great. There are several pieces to get the bottle assembled but not hard to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Smithson

customer_reviews.title: Leak like crazy!
customer_reviews.text: I initially liked these bottles because my newborn was able to use the nipple easily, but the leaking is RIDICULOUS. Basically, the bottle is not all one piece - the bottom plastic part attaches to the body of the bottle with a rubber insert in between. Therefore, leaks can occur between the bottom and the rubber insert. No matter what I do - tighten A LOT, tighten not too much, make sure all the parts are dry, etc etc - these inevitably leak. Shame because the nipples are great, but the leakage is just too annoying (plus a waste of precious pumped milk). I will be returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah K.

customer_reviews.title: Heading back to work
customer_reviews.text: Omg. I wouldn’t have believed it unless I saw it myself. My baby took this bottle with NO fuss. I go back to work tomorrow and this was a lifesaver, I worried way too much as he will absolutely not take any other bottle or any pacifier at all. This came yesterday and it’s a gift from God. I’ve tried many many other bottles with great reviews but none have worked, so thankful I went ahead and tried one more!
customer_reviews.author: Roxan K

customer_reviews.title: Grandson has never had colic with MAM
customer_reviews.text: Make sure the bottom seal is in correctly as it's not gonna self correct, and if you're using kitchen gloves, you can't get the seal out. Make sure the lid is going on perfectly too, otherwise you and baby will end up soaked really quick (not a fun middle of the night moment!) BUT that said, these are really nice for keeping baby's tummy from getting colic, they hold up really well, even if tossed across the room- as kids are want to do sometimes, the nipple stays put and doesn't explode out like other bottles have so less mess for me to deal with. My grandson is a rowdy boy and MAM is up to the challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara!Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Anti-gas bottles that don't leak and easy to sterilize
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend these bottles. I switched from Como Tomo and Dr. Brown's bottles to MAM bottles. My baby was gassy with Como Tomos and Dr. Brown's bottles leaked all the time. MAM bottles work great in reducing gas and ease of use. Yes, they have many parts, but if assembled correctly, it works. The ability to self-sterilize in the microwave is a great bonus. One negative i consistently experience is *sometimes* it is easy to not screw the top lid on the right way and results in some leakage. However, this is a user error, not necessary the company.
customer_reviews.author: cycling nerd

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: When I first saw these bottles I thought they were ugly. LoL ! I got a free one in the mail so I decided to try it. I had bought my son Tombie tippie, avent , Dr. Browns, and playtex bottled because I wasn’t sure which ones he would like. Out of all those bottles my son preferred the MAM bottle and the MAM pacifiers. He was breast feed for two months and the unique nipple soothed him. I would recommend giving the MAM a try
customer_reviews.author: pinkheart05

customer_reviews.title: ehh 😐 idk
customer_reviews.text: i’m actually kind of disappointed in this bottle cause i had such high hopes. My cons that resulted in a 3 star review aren’t too bad but it’s a inconvenience. the cap just pops off and the others i have are tight and the measurements are hard to see when there is milk inside even in good lighting 🙄
customer_reviews.author: Heather P

customer_reviews.title: 2 size nipple was just perfect to control the flow during his feedings
customer_reviews.text: I bought them for my Newborn Grandson. He was diagnosed with reflux at 2 weeks old and we had to start putting cereal in his bottles. Through many trial and errors we found that the MAM bottles with the Medium flow no. 2 size nipple was just perfect to control the flow during his feedings. He had less spitting up episodes and less frustration trying to take his bottles. It also helped to alleviate gas in his tummy. An added plus is that these bottles can be sterilized in the microwave.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great bottle!
customer_reviews.text: Great bottles! My son wouldn't have take the Avent naturals, which my previous two used just fine. I tried a few bottles and this is the one he decided to latch onto. The nipple seems like it would be liked by most breastfed babies. They're a good price and easy to clean. I feel like he gets less air when using these bottles as well since air can be sucked in from the bottom if needed due to the rubber seal at the bottom. No leaking. Cute colors and pictures on the bottles. Not sure they won't scratch off easily, but we'll see. Would definitely recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Endra

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This brand was recommended by our lactation consultant. We had some Avent bottles already but found our breastfed baby cried and choked while using them. We ordered this brand instead and VERY happy with them. Baby takes bottle lying on her side so she doesn’t choke, and the shape of the nipple makes it easy to give her every last drop of milk in this position. She figured this nipple out right away.
customer_reviews.author: D. Downs

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We found out our baby likes the Mam pacifiers so we finally tried out the bottles. I LOVE them! I wish it wasn’t so many pieces though. I don’t think it needs to be “self sterilizing” by putting it in the microwave a certain way. I was tempted to buy one of the other bottles & just switch out the nipple but I got this one for a good deal so I figured I’d try it. If your baby doesn’t latch to cylinder nipples/pacifiers (like avent) , or the one lump sided nipples/pacifiers (like nuk) I HIGHLY HIGHLY suggest one of these! It’s flat on both sides and my 3 month old just loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: BEST BOTTLES EVER
customer_reviews.text: I love these bottles! Both of my babies took these without any issues (one of which is BF) Years ago I met a women at Disney Land who was looking to transition from bottle to breast but she could not find a bottle that her daughter would take. I offered her one of my MAM bottles to try. It was perfect because they can be sanitized themselves in the microwave in only 3 mins! I caught up with her the next day and sure enough her baby was drinking from the MAM bottle!
customer_reviews.author: morgan Vandee

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been nursing my daughter since she was born in December and I decided to start working from home so I didn't have to worry about getting her on a bottle before I went back to work, well now I can't get a break because not even my husband can feed her because she resisted every bottle I tried with her, until this one!! She took to this instantly. I am so relieved and now I get some feeding breaks. If you are searching for a bottle/nipple becuase your baby won't take others give this a try!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good bottle easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I like this bottle. I started my baby on tommee tippee closer to nature, she takes this bottle pretty well I would say it flows a little faster than her other bottle but I wish I would have had this mam bottle first I just like it over all better. Up date ordered 2 more and one of the bottle nipples is like a fast flow and chokes the baby so bad. I just bought extra slow flow nipples but be aware that obviously some of them are not true to size, if you will.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Riley

customer_reviews.title: Only bottle my daugher will take!
customer_reviews.text: Only bottle my daughter will take. Tried several different kinds for my daughter who is breastfed and this is the only one she will take. It took a few times of her refusing or only partially sucking on this but she finally got it. She would scream when any other bottle came near. I had never had this problem with my son (who used a different brand) so couldn't believe my daughter would be so picky. Luckily my daycare provider mentioned these have a different nipple shape than most so thought I should give them a shot and they worked!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: We love these bottles! The only bottles that my preemie daughter would take. There are several pieces for each bottle, I really like that you completely disassemble it to clean it, I finally feel like I can get a bottle completely clean! The only time we've had a leak is when we've threaded the collar on incorrectly. The lavender girly version is much easier to read the measurement markings than the white gender neutral bottles. We've always hand washed them, we've been using them for 4 months and they still look brand new, no fading, no print rubbing/flaking off. We very much recommend these bottles!
customer_reviews.author: Lovely.Lady.Laura.Lee

customer_reviews.title: Best kept secret!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! My baby is 3 weeks old and he is breastfed. These bottles are great for giving him the expressed milk and he takes either the bottle or the breast with no problem. No nipple confusion. I breastfed from birth and introduced the bottle on the 4th day and never had any issues. They are easy to take apart to clean and reassemble.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for tongue-tied babies that spit up and may have colic!
customer_reviews.text: These bottles are truly amazing for tongue-tied babies! I have tried the como tomo and avent but both were giving my daughter acid reflux where she started screaming at 7 PM every night. I thought it was colic but it was actually the pain from spitting up all the time. She would spit up and soak me at every burp. Since I changed to MAM bottles, She’s able to get a great latch and hasn’t thrown up once since! I took her off her acid reflux medication And life is really good. Definitely try these if you’re having a lot of throw up and fussiness while hearing a lot of air going into your current bottle!
customer_reviews.author: Heather B.

customer_reviews.title: Buy these now!
customer_reviews.text: I previoisly recieved and reviewed these for a promotion. That first review was not a great one... but now they are all my daughter will use! Now they are the only bottle she will use.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is a LEGIT brand. My son decided not to eat 2 weeks into using a different bottle, and after a hospital stay and 1 of the hospital specialists trying this, he ate again. We bought their pacifiers too, and even though he spit out the other brand, he really took to this 1. Wish we had known about these bottles to begin with, could've literally saved thousands lol.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the only nottle baby will take
customer_reviews.text: We tried different bottles (Aventi and Dr Browns) before we ended up with MAM. These are the only bottles my baby drinks from. It has an unique shape of the nipple, which I think helped my baby to transfer to a bottle. I would recommend it to any mom that baby is picky, at least it is definitely worth a try. I was worrying when my baby didn't want to drink from a bottle and I was about to return to work. I am glad I tried them. It has been over 2 months since my baby is in the day care, and we didn't have any nipple confusion. I am still able to breastfeed at home
customer_reviews.author: Mama

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: I never understand when people say these bottles leak... iv never ever had that issue when correctly tighting the bottom and top. I was in love with the Dr Browns bottles because they really helped with my colic baby however I got fed up with the constant messes and wasted formula they ALL leaked SO bad. But iv bought 4 of these MAM bottles and no leaks at all and GREAT for colic babies.. Very happy mommy.
customer_reviews.author: Dwain Hunter

customer_reviews.text: These bottles saved my baby from colic and reflux. They are a little difficult to wash but not as crazy as some anti-colic bottles. customer_reviews.author: Annieming

customer_reviews.title: Good bottle
customer_reviews.text: My 5 month old baby girl has always used mam pacifiers so we decided to purchase one mam bottle to try it out. These bottles DONT leak from the side of the mouth (which I’ve had problems with other bottles doing) and the flow is just right for our daughter. The bottle also can steam sanitize itself in the microwave as shown in the video above which is convenient. I would purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Complicated bottles
customer_reviews.text: These bottles are kind of a pain because they come with 6 parts! You have the top, the nipple, the collar, the bottle body, the gasket?, and the bottle bottom. HOWEVER, These bottles are great for keeping out the air. I feel like because they have so many pieces, it is possible to get everything CLEAN. They are also self sanitizing in the microwave. You have to be careful to make sure when you screw on the bottom, you don’t kink the gasket because if you do the bottle will leak!
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: This bottle was made by the hands of God!
customer_reviews.text: Hallelujah! I had 12 weeks mat leave and could not find a bottle my baby would drink expressed milk from. Nothing is as good as the boob, but this bottle is the next best thing! The day before I returned to work, he took this bottle! I had spent >$200 on 9 different bottles and a lot being big name brands. A friend had a coworker with the same issue of her baby not taking a bottle and this one was her god send! So happy and there is enough anxiety going back to work after having a baby and thankfully a bottle is not one of my anxieties.
customer_reviews.author: Mielnicki family

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: I love these. They are very cute. I have a little boy and got the beige, purple, and blue ones, 2 of each. And he accepted them right off the bat. Albeit I havent tried any other bottles... these work for me! If you count the cap cover, there are six pieces that it comes apart into to wash but honestly its so easy. Would it be faster with a simple bottle? Yes, but it isnt that many more steps. Just be very careful to make sure you screw on the nipple holder cap thing on straight or you will wonder how your baby is drinking so fast only to realize that it had spilled all over his chest!
customer_reviews.author: Danaya Khartchenko

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY bottle my baby would use.

customer_reviews.author: Shaggy Y. P.

I didn’t check how he did it, poured breast milk into one and slowly most of it leaked out. You really need to make sure you secure the bottom half to avoid any loss of liquids. Easy to clean? With their self desinfecting system, yes.
customer_reviews.author: Katlin

customer_reviews.title: I love this bottle.
customer_reviews.text: I love this bottle. My 4th daughter would only use this bottle and my 5th daughter was born cleft. customer_reviews.title: Great for breastfed babes

customer_reviews.author: Amber M

customer_reviews.title: Onky bottle my daughter will take
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has been fortunate that she has been able to have me (mom) home with her for the first 4 1/2 months of her life. Unfortunately for my husband and me, my daughter now refuses bottles and only wants to drink from the breast. We have tried so many types of bottles. Some one gave this me and I thought there is no way it would work, but my daughter actually takes them!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Great bottle, although washing is a pain
customer_reviews.text: Washing is a pain (but not as bad as dr brown) but my picky son loves this bottle! This is the only bottle that he would take. We literally tried every major brand out there except komotomo. I simply didn't want to spend so much money on baby bottles. So.. You can microwave to sanitize, and that's so handy while traveling.
customer_reviews.author: egan

After reading the reviews for these bottles I was convinced these were it. Although they were easy to clean and use, they did absolutely nothing for the air in the bottle itself and the gas for him. They’re just like any plastic bottle out there. It seems the vented bottom does nothing. I found platex nurser bottles with the drop in disposable inserts and they have been our saving grace. I gave these bottles away.
customer_reviews.author: Jessika Estrada

customer_reviews.title: Familiar like the pacifier
customer_reviews.text: My son is 8 weeks and really likes these bottles. He takes the MAM pacifiers so these are familiar to him. He is mostly breastfed but gets one bottle a day usually. He'd rather have the bottle than nurse! I took one star away because I've had them leak more than once. If the white piece in the bottom isn't exactly right, the milk runs through it. When you have a crying baby and you're trying to hurry and make a bottle, this is easy to do and super annoying.
customer_reviews.author: John & Erika

customer_reviews.title: Life savers!

customer_reviews.author: toxicblyss

customer_reviews.title: Great bottles
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried about 10 different brands and styles of bottles to figure out which works best for my son. The MAM bottles have by far been the best. My son had horrible gas and would get upset stomach often. After going solely with MAM bottles his gas reduced, had less gas and he was overall much happier and comfortable. With the MAM bottles he also had less dripage and overflow when feeding. I also like how they gave the vented bottom and not all the additional parts that go into the bottle to send the air. It’s easy to clean and very durable. I would recommend these bottles to anyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley N Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Best bottles.
customer_reviews.text: After trying a number of baby bottles, these were my favorite by a large margin, for the following reasons: 1. customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a bottle you and your baby will love? Try these.
customer_reviews.text: Baby loves the unique wide nipple shape that fits his mouth. I love that you can just pop them in the microwave with no special equipment to sanitize them. It's easy to switch to a faster or slower nipple as baby's needs change and the alternate flow nipples are a good value. If you are trying out bottles to find the right one for your baby, you should definitely add one of these to your samples. These were both our baby's favorite and our favorite design.
customer_reviews.author: WJD

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE these bottles

They are easy to clean as everything comes apart and have withstood many a boiling to sterilize them. They've never become distorted and the graphics are still just as vibrant as new. Speaking of boiling bottles .. I also just discovered that these are designed to be self sterilizing in the microwave ! No other things needed.. they come with a brochure that shows how this is done.. (that I never looked at for the past 2 years. Oops!)
customer_reviews.author: Kelly B.

customer_reviews.title: Great bottle for gassy babies!

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bottle for newborns

I have tried several top of the line bottles and I this one beat them every time.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Knight

customer_reviews.title: Love these bottles
customer_reviews.text: After reading about different brands I chose MAM for my now 3 month old breast fed baby. She took right to it without issues, no problems with nipple confusion as she usually only uses a bottle while at daycare. These are easy to clean I like how you can take them all apart and the fact they’re a self contained unit when it comes to sterilizeing them in the microwave.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Bad Design. No separate bottle cap.
customer_reviews.text: Bottle design is bad! Separate base is easy to clean, but when you heat the bottle in the bottle warmer, water from the warmer get trapped near the base. My biggest problem with it is it doesn't have a separate cap, so cannot shake the bottle well (or milk came out of the nipple) and formula sometimes doesn't desovle completely. We have used Doc brown and it is better even though there is more parts to clean.
customer_reviews.author: N.L

customer_reviews.title: Great for breastfed baby
customer_reviews.text: My 3 month old loves the mam bottles! After being exclusively breastfed for three months, she did not want to take a bottle. We tried nanobebe, avent, Dr. Brown’s, munchkin, tommee tippee, nuk, playtex, and como tomo with no success. Took several tries for her to get used the mam, but now she takes 4 oz happily! The flat nipple is easy for her to grab and stays in her mouth. Easy to assemble and wash. We sanitize the nipple and gasket once per week. The size 2 nipple worked well for our 3 month old.
customer_reviews.author: Cirea22

customer_reviews.title: Byebye Colic
customer_reviews.text: Must say, what I love about mam bottles is that they stand up to their name. This is truly one of the best anti-colic bottles on the market. (Move over Dr Brown) the anti-colic vented system works wonderfully by venting all excess air while baby feeds. The European bottles are BPA and BPS free, protecting baby from any possible plastic chemicals. The self sterilization is another great feature this bottle has. If you want to get rid of those nights of colic crystal this is the bottle for you.

I had high hopes for this because of it's wide mouth design and the other great reviews, but unfortunately, it just depends on the kid. There's nothing special about this one.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie M

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: We love MAM bottles in our household. My little one would not latch to other bottle brands so we decided to try this since she loves their pacifiers. They have been so great and she latched right away to the nipple. She breastfeeds mostly but on occasion will have a bottle due to me being out for too long and needing a feeding if she is with her father or grandparents. This product is truly great for babies that are used to breast feeding but needing to take a bottle on occasion.
